title: ‘CoComelon’ Owner Nears Sale to Blackstone-Backed Company for More Than $2.75 Billion
sub_head: Deal would mark second major entertainment acquisition this year for firm led by Kevin Mayer and Tom Staggs after Hello Sunshine deal
body:
Moonbug Entertainment Ltd., the company behind hit children’s shows “CoComelon” and “Blippi,” is close to a deal to sell to a media company backed by private-equity firm Blackstone Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.
The deal would value Moonbug at more than $2.75 billion, the people said. The talks are advanced and the deal could be announced in the coming days, the people said. Terms aren’t finalized and the deal could still fall apart.
